div.l: Alle can he pley on gitterne and Ribibill
Revel and trouth as in a lowe degre
They be fulle wroth alday as mēn may se
This ioly prentes wᵗith his maister stode
Tille he was nere out of his prentishode
Al were he stiborn both erly and late
And somtyme led wᵗith revel to Nevgate
Where he his vnthriftenes sore abought
But at last his maister hȳm besthoughtbesoughtbethought
Vpon a ꝓproverbe that seith the same worde
Wol bet is rotyn apill out of horde
Than that he roten alle the remenant
So fareth hit by a ryetouse seruant
Hit is fulle lasse harme to let hym pas
Than he shold al the seru~auntꝭes in the plas
Therfore his maister yaue hȳm acquitau~aunce
And bade hym goo wᵗith sorowe ⁊and myschau~aunce
And thus this ioly prentes had his leue
Nowe let hym ryot alle the nyght or leue
And there is no theff wᵗith outen look
That helpeth hym to waste or to sowke
Of that he bribe can or borowe may
Anone he selleth his bed and his aray
Vnto a compire of his owne sorte
That loueth dyse riot and disporte
And had wiff that holde for contenau~aunce
A shoppe and swyvede for his sustenau~aunce
Here endeth the Cokes tale.

And
begynneth the mān of lawes ꝓprologe
Ovre hoste sawe that by the brighte sonne
The ark of his artificial day had ronne
The fourth part and halfe an houre and more
